target.topic: Brexit impact on the Gaeltacht economy
references: impact of Brexit on the Gaeltacht economy

justifications: Udaras na Gaeltachta has issued a statement outlining the impact of Brexit on the Gaeltacht economy.
Udaras says in the short term, the industry most likely to be impacted by Brexit is tourism.
The UK market is the first step to export for many of their client companies based in the Gaeltacht area.
The agency says that will now very much depend on how the value of Sterling works out over the coming months.
Nearly 20% of Udaras client companies' export sales are to the UK and are worth â‚¬100 million a year.
With a total of 3.3 million UK tourists visiting Ireland each year, a falling Sterling rate means Ireland may be less competitive for UK tourists in monetary terms.
